ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary:
User-friendly package for reporting replicability-analysis methods, affixed to meta-analyses
summary. The replicability-analysis output provides an assessment of the investigated
intervention, where it offers quantification of effect replicability and assessment
of the consistency of findings.

User-friendly package for reporting replicability-analysis methods, affixed to meta-analyses
summary. The replicability-analysis output provides an assessment of the investigated
intervention, where it offers quantification of effect replicability and assessment
of the consistency of findings.

name: r-metarep
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.2.1" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-metarep
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/metarep_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/metarep/metarep_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 12341d5c0b0e26b88071d2f2a05b330b4713303509f17be3a1fe5b3d72d6765c

build:
  noarch: generic
  number: 0
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/
  missing_dso_whitelist:
    - '*/R.dll'        # [win]
    - '*/Rblas.dll'    # [win]
    - '*/Rlapack.dll'  # [win]

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-meta >=6.0_0
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-meta >=6.0_0

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('metarep')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('metarep')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/IJaljuli/metarep
  license: GPL-2.0-or-later
  summary: |
    User-friendly package for reporting replicability-analysis methods, affixed to meta-analyses
    summary. The replicability-analysis output provides an assessment of the investigated
    intervention, where it offers quantification of effect replicability and assessment
    of the consistency of findings.
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: metarep
# Title: Replicability-Analysis Tools for Meta-Analysis
# Version: 1.2.0
# Depends: R (>= 4.1), meta (>= 6.0-0)
# Suggests: metafor (>= 1.9.9), lme4, numDeriv, BiasedUrn, knitr, rmarkdown
# Authors@R: person("Iman","Jaljuli", role=c("cre","aut"), email="jaljuli.iman@gmail.com")
# Date: 2023-12-15
# URL: https://github.com/IJaljuli/metarep
# Description: User-friendly package for reporting replicability-analysis methods, affixed to meta-analyses summary. The replicability-analysis output provides an assessment of the investigated intervention, where it offers quantification of effect replicability and assessment of the consistency of findings. - Replicability-analysis for fixed-effects and random-effect meta analysis: - r(u)-value; - lower bounds on the number of studies with replicated positive and\or negative effect; - Allows detecting inconsistency of signals; - forest plots with the summary of replicability analysis results; - Allows Replicability-analysis with or without the common-effect assumption.
# License: GPL (>= 2)
# Encoding: UTF-8
# NeedsCompilation: yes
# RoxygenNote: 7.2.3
# VignetteBuilder: knitr
# LazyData: true
# Packaged: 2023-12-15 18:05:08 UTC; jaljuli
# Author: Iman Jaljuli [cre, aut]
# Maintainer: Iman Jaljuli <jaljuli.iman@gmail.com>
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2023-12-15 18:20:02 UTC
